books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: The story of the mysteriously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan, set in the 1920s.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: The story of a young girl named Scout growing up in the racially-charged South and her father's defense of a black man accused of rape.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where individuality is suppressed and government control is absolute.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: The story of the Bennet sisters and their quest for love and marriage in 19th century England.

books.title: The Hunger Games
books.author: Suzanne Collins
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a future North America where teenagers are forced to fight to the death in a televised event called the Hunger Games.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: An epic fantasy novel set in the fictional world of Middle-earth, following hobbit Frodo Baggins as he attempts to destroy the powerful One Ring and save the world from the evil Sauron.
